skillTree.localised_description: The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: Hellsteeds are vicious. Vampires that dabble in the binding of beasts delight in breaking these wild creatures to their will.

skillTree.localised_description: These coaches serve as a way of transporting a Vampire anywhere he wishes, plowing through any opposition that would dare to stand in her way.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

skillTree.localised_description: These deceptive creatures look so inoffensive and vulnerable that the enemy lowers his own defence, which is when they strike…

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

skillTree.localised_description: This Prophetess has a natural mastery over the Winds of Magic, which allows her to cloak and dissipate the Aethyric distortions around her.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: The children she took from her peasants she raised as her own, as fellow acolytes in the dark arts, assisting her in her sinister research and often giving their very souls to power the spells she learned.

effects.description: Effect range: +50% for "Master of the Dead"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: Though Nicolete has several acolytes at large in the Old World hunting down occult tomes and magical trinkets, she believes all knowledge ultimately comes from within, to be unlocked by introspection and experimentation.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%
	(accompanying Lord)

skillTree.localised_description: Nicolete has a deep-seated dislike of other Humans and far prefers the company of her acolytes, who by now are dry, wizened drones respond instantly to her every wish and never speak.

enabled_if: No friendly units in ability range.

skillTree.localised_description: Where most mages were weakened by repeated exposure to dark magic, Nicolete’s keen intellect and great dedication meant she only grew stronger and more vigorous, even as her adopted children became corrupted and died around her.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: Though her real interests lie in scholarship, Nicolete is a powerful if unpredictable sorceress. Mallobaude contacted her through Aucassin, and she believed completely the bizarre and shocking “truth” he explained to her, since it scarcely seemed impossible compared to the esoteric knowledge she was seeking.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn

skillTree.localised_description: It is no easy task to bend or break the armour of this being.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
This one will not go down easily – it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
An omen, a sign - this being knows things and any who follow will share their glory.
Never to be broken or dishonoured – never to succumb to the foe.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: As the powers of Dark Magic are wielded for the purpose of Necromancy, its unwholesome energies invigorate the Undead.

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

skillTree.localised_description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for "Raise Dead Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

effects.description: Damage Building action: Additional 5% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 15% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:

items.colour_text: Shortly after her husband’s death, Nicolete took a suitor. A foreigner, people claimed that the man was a Wizard from the Border Kingdoms. The romance lasted for a few short weeks and then, suddenly, the man vanished. The only sign of the relationship was the Wizard’s brooch which Nicolete, ever after, always wore. The Blood Opal Brooch is a pale pink stone veined in crimson in a brass setting. The Brooch looks like a large spider, with the stone serving as its abdomen.

Woven by Nicolete herself, the Gown of Tears is a long fitted black dress studded with moonstones that sparkle in the light. Said to be made from the hair of the children she’s abducted, it is reinforced by dark sorcery.

The centrepiece of this exquisite gromril headwear is a fist-sized black diamond. When worn, it pulses with an unholy light. The true history of the Black Diamond Tiara is lost to time. Legend holds that Nicolete, in her youth, journeyed to Tilea for a time. When she returned to Oisement, she wore this exquisite crown. It’s whispered that it was stolen from a tomb in ancient Khemri, and when held in a certain light, the image of a scarab can be seen suspended in the stone, reinforcing such beliefs.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent in melee or casting spells.
